docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (MTV, Logo, VH1) 2012 MTV MOVIE AWARDS Russell Brand, above, hosts this show, broadcast live from the Gibson Theater in Universal City, Calif., which bestows the Golden Popcorn statuettes on winners in ''best'' categories like kiss, villain, fight, jaw-dropping moment and breakout star. New ''bests'' include hero, on-screen transformation, gut-wrenching performance and on-screen dirtbag. Johnny Depp will be honored with the MTV Generation Award. Presenters include Adam Sandler, Emma Watson, Leighton Meester, Emma Stone, Andrew Garfield, Charlize Theron, Michael Fassbender and Matthew McConaughey. The director Christopher Nolan and the actors Christian Bale, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Gary Oldman will be on hand for a preview of their film ''The Dark Knight Rises.'' Performers include the Black Keys, in a rendition of their single ''Gold in the Ceiling''; Fun., in a tribute to the greatest party films of all time; and the rapper Wiz Khalifa. Martin Solveig will be the house D.J. Ashton Kutcher will punk Kim Kardashian and Drake in a preparty at 8. The Season 2 premiere of ''Teen Wolf'' follows at 11. 8:30 A.M. (BBC AMERICA); 9 A.M. (Fox News Channel); 11 A.M. (CNN) QUEEN ELIZABETH II'S DIAMOND JUBILEE Britain celebrates the 60-year reign of Queen Elizabeth -- only Victoria ruled longer -- as a flotilla of more than 1,000 boats adorned with streamers and Union Jacks sails down the Thames. On BBC America, a marathon of tell-alls, including ''William & Kate: The First Year,'' at 7 p.m., leads up to ''The Diamond Queen,'' at 8, in which Andrew Marr interviews royals and Prime Minster David Cameron to analyze the effect of the royal family on British trade and international relations. At 9, C-Span will broadcast the arrival of the queen, above, at Parliament, where the speakers of the House of Commons and the House of Lords will pay tribute to the occasion, and she will offer comments in return. And at 4:15 a.m. on Tuesday on BBC America, early risers can catch the queen and Prince Philip as they attend a service of thanksgiving at St. Paul's Cathedral, followed by a carriage procession.

headline.main: What's the Best Way to Break Society's Bad Habits?

docs.abstract: Is it the government's role to change people's behavior and make them live healthier lives? And if so, what's the most effective way to do it?
docs.snippet: Is it the government's role to change people's behavior and make them live healthier lives? And if so, what's the most effective way to do it?

docs.abstract: On a recent trip back to the United States, I received a sober reminder of the saddest side of America, in an unexpectedly cheery cover.
docs.snippet: On a recent trip back to the United States, I received a sober reminder of the saddest side of America, in an unexpectedly cheery cover.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lobbyists and researchers who have proven adept at combating other government regulatory efforts find themselves scrambling to counterattack the mayor’s proposal.

headline.seo: Soda Industry Maps Campaign to Defeat Bloomberg Plan
headline.main: Soda Industry Maps Strategy to Defeat Bloomberg Plan to Ban Super-Size Drinks
headline.print_headline: Soda Industry Maps Strategy to Defeat Bloomberg Plan to Ban Super-Size Drinks

docs.abstract: Soda industry was blindsided by New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's proposal to ban the sale of large-sized sweetened beverages at virtually all of the city's restaurants, street carts and theaters; an army of lobbyists and researchers are scrambling to plan a counterattack that could include a fight at the state legislative level, or even court.
docs.snippet: Lobbyists and researchers who have proven adept at combating other government regulatory efforts find themselves scrambling to counterattack the mayor’s proposal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sampling the many responses to Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s new plan in New York City.
docs.snippet: Sampling the many responses to Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s new plan in New York City.

docs.lead_paragraph: The decision for the tests, which will begin next week, came on the heels of a ruling by the Food and Drug Administration to deny renaming high-fructose corn syrup to corn sugar.

headline.seo: Agriculture Department Calls for More Beef Testing
headline.main: Government to Increase E. Coli Tests in Raw Beef
headline.print_headline: Government To Increase E. Coli Tests In Raw Beef

docs.abstract: Agriculture Department says it will expand testing for E. coli in raw beef trimmings; ruling appears to side with consumers, and comes on the heels of a Food and Drug Administration decision to deny renaming high-fructose corn syrup to corn sugar; Consumers Union applauds both decisions.
docs.snippet: The decision for the tests, which will begin next week, came on the heels of a ruling by the Food and Drug Administration to deny renaming high-fructose corn syrup to corn sugar.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some New Yorkers took it hard when they learned the mayor wanted to take away their plus-size sodas.

headline.seo: To Gulp or to Sip? Debating a Crackdown on Big Sugary Drinks
headline.main: To Gulp or to Sip? Debating a Crackdown on Big Sugary Drinks
headline.print_headline: To Gulp or to Sip? Debating a Crackdown On Big Sugary Drinks

docs.abstract: New Yorkers react to Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's proposed ban prohibiting the sale of any cup or bottle of sugar-sweetened drink larger than 16 fluid ounces.
docs.snippet: Some New Yorkers took it hard when they learned the mayor wanted to take away their plus-size sodas.

byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting.
